metadata.synopsis: The player must now make a choice that will direct how the ending will potentially play out.Main decisions: - Give the Emperor the stones - Keep the stones - Become a full Mind Flayer - Reject the Emperor's solutions-  Free Orpheus
metadata.how_to_trigger: oe end_startillithidoptionsFinish dialogTalk to the Emperor again by Orpheus

57.speaker: The Emperor
57.text: I have assessed our encounter with the Netherbrain from every angle. I know why we failed.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orphues levitating in globe, chained

321.speaker: The Emperor
321.text: The problem was not the stones, the problem was you.
321.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

320.speaker: The Emperor
320.text: You can make only one move at a time. But the Netherbrain calculates every possible move at once.
320.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

282.speaker: The Emperor
282.text: It knows what you will do, it knows everything you could possibly do. You cannot outmanoeuvre it.
282.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

133.speaker: The Emperor
133.text: To defeat it, you would have to think like an illithid. Better yet, be one. Your mind is not capable of this.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

153.speaker: The Emperor
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

164.speaker: The Emperor
164.text: You will give the stones to me. I will assimilate Orpheus, and then I will be able to leave this Prism to face the brain.
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! We must drive a blade through the foul prince's belly!
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

244.speaker: Lae'zel
244.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! We must drive a blade through the foul prince's belly!
244.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

177.speaker: The Emperor
177.text: If you kill Orpheus now, you will doom yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall. You cannot approach the brain without the prince's protection.
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

172.speaker: The Emperor
172.text: I can consume his thoughts, his knowledge, his brain. His powers. The process would kill him.
172.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

295.speaker: Lae'zel
295.text: The traitor prince, dead at last - my queen's mission fulfilled...
295.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: No. I will not accept it. This cannot be the only way. Vlaakith will provide!
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

219.speaker: The Emperor
219.text: Is this not the outcome your queen wanted, Lae'zel? Her reward will be yours for the taking.
219.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

8.speaker: The Emperor
8.text: The prince will be dead. And we will still stand a chance against the Netherbrain. Now - give me the stones.
8.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

230.speaker: Player
230.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*
230.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

113.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*
113.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*
68.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

351.speaker: Narrator
351.text: *You might refuse the Emperor and break Orpheus free with the Hammer. You can defeat the Netherbrain with the prince as an ally.*
351.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

145.speaker: Narrator
145.text: *Afterwards, Lae'zel can strike down Prince Orpheus. Vlaakith's bidding will be done.*
145.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: When you say 'assimilate' Orpheus - what do you mean by that?
169.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

213.speaker: Player
213.text: When you say 'assimilate' Orpheus - what do you mean by that?
213.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

38.speaker: The Emperor
38.text: I will consume his thoughts, his knowledge, his brain.
38.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

389.speaker: Player
389.text: So you would kill him. He is Gith's heir! You'd be your own people's betrayer. You'd be my betrayer.
389.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

405.speaker: Lae'zel
405.text: So you would kill him. He is Gith's heir! You'd be the githyanki people's betrayer. You'd be my betrayer.
405.context: NodeContext: first line to Emperor, last line to player

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I realise he is of some significance to you, but he is of even more value to our cause.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

242.speaker: The Emperor
242.text: I realise he is of some significance to you, but he is of even more value to our cause.
242.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to Lae'zel if she is present

367.speaker: Player
367.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

58.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

312.speaker: Narrator
312.text: *Within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

199.speaker: Narrator
199.text: *You might refuse the Emperor and break Orpheus free with the Hammer. You can defeat the Netherbrain with the prince as an ally.*

130.speaker: Narrator
130.text: *Afterwards, you can strike down Prince Orpheus. Vlaakith's bidding will be done.*

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Would I be able to wield the stones myself if I become illithid and assimilate Orpheus?
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand that to normal positionNodeContext: a little surprised

223.speaker: The Emperor
223.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand that to normal positionNodeContext: a little surprised

390.speaker: Player
390.text: I don't care about Orpheus, but I want to wield the stones myself.
390.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand back to normal position

400.speaker: The Emperor
400.text: Then you must become a mind flayer. It is the only way.
400.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand back to normal position

46.speaker: The Emperor
46.text: You have embraced transformation so far, but this would be a complete evolution.
46.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

0.speaker: The Emperor
0.text: You have resisted such a fate so far. And this would be a complete evolution.
0.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

217.speaker: The Emperor
217.text: And you will be an illithid for the rest of your days.
217.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

27.speaker: The Emperor
27.text: Is this really something you would be willing to accept?
27.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *Why should you be the one to make the sacrifice? Karlach offered. You could let her take the fall, and when the moment comes, kill her, and take control.*
166.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

194.speaker: Narrator
194.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: I have nothing to lose anymore. I'm burning up - burning out. But this is something I can still do - this is how I can help save the city I love.

305.speaker: Lae'zel
305.text: Are none of you capable of thinking beyond yourselves? My people's future hangs in the balance, and you're clamouring to be martyrs.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: That you even entertain this ghaik shows you have learned nothing from our time together.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: The Emperor may be a mind flayer, but we have needed all the help we've received. I don't think we should stop now.

220.speaker: Lae'zel
220.text: We hold the means to free the Prince of the Comet. How is this even a debate?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Karlach is right. I'd rather trust her than Orpheus or the Emperor. Even as an illithid.

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: Has the tadpole finally devoured what was left of your rational thought? We retrieved the Hammer, only for it to come to naught?

299.speaker: Player
299.text: Lae'zel is right - assimilation is not our only option.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: Finally - a modicum of rational thought.

347.speaker: Karlach
347.text: We have more options than we knew, Lae'zel. Give me the chance to convince you.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Let's take a moment, think about this.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Has everyone's brains leaked from their skulls? We took the Orphic Hammer for a reason. 'Think', indeed.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Before you decide, let us speak of Orpheus - alone.
127.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

368.speaker: Lae'zel
368.text: Before you decide, let us speak of Orpheus - alone.
368.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

163.speaker: Lae'zel
163.text: Before you decide - let us speak.
163.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

35.speaker: Jaheira
35.text: Hold a moment. We are not so short on time that we cannot stop and think about this.
35.context: NodeContext: Trying to slow things down - the player just volunteered to sacrifice themselves, and she's urging us to stop and talk it through with her companions. Projecting calm and reason.

101.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
101.text: Do not take this step without consulting me. You decide all of our fates.
101.context: NodeContext: Stern, really doesn't want you deciding anything too quickly

179.speaker: Wyll
179.text: This isn't a decision to take lightly. We should talk first.
179.context: NodeContext: Stern, really doesn't want you deciding anything too quickly

193.speaker: Shadowheart
193.text: This isn't a decision to make in haste - let's discuss it together beforehand.
193.context: NodeContext: Stern, really doesn't want you deciding anything too quickly

210.speaker: Gale
210.text: This is not the kind of decision to make based solely on your own wisdom. We must discuss it - privately.
210.context: NodeContext: Stern, really doesn't want you deciding anything too quickly

255.speaker: Astarion
255.text: Let's not be hasty about this. I think this warrants a more private discussion, away from that silver-tentacled illithid.

272.speaker: Minsc
272.text: This is not a decision to be taken lightly. As the very least, take a moment to seek Boo's wisdom.

302.speaker: Halsin
302.text: This is not a decision to make in haste. Let us talk it over, first.

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: Hang on - we need to talk this through. There's so much at stake...

131.speaker: The Emperor
131.text: It is a big decision, perhaps the biggest you will ever make. No doubt your allies will have their opinions on it. Talk to them, before you commit - once you do, there will be no turning back.

189.speaker: The Emperor
189.text: Karlach will become the mind flayer.
189.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves Karlach's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in Karlach's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in Karlach's palm. 
Shot o Karlach's expression reacting to it.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Karlach will become the mind flayer.
205.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves Karlach's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in Karlach's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in Karlach's palm. 
Shot o Karlach's expression reacting to it.

198.speaker: The Emperor
198.text: Very well. I have the means to evolve you.
198.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves Karlach's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in Karlach's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in Karlach's palm. 
Shot o Karlach's expression reacting to it.

304.speaker: The Emperor
304.text: I took this one from the nautiloid. I have been nurturing it ever since - priming it for your use.
304.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves Karlach's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in Karlach's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in Karlach's palm. 
Shot o Karlach's expression reacting to it.

94.text: Open your mind to it. Its latent potential will do the rest.
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

97.speaker: The Emperor
97.text: Open your mind to it. Its latent potential will do the rest.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: 'Latent potential'. All right - let's do this. I'm ready! Turn me, dammit!
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, Karlach turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

149.text: *She is transformed. Her body is no longer hers, but her eyes, her heart - she is still Karlach, for now. Only - there's a hunger in her eyes that wasn't there before.*
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, Karlach turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *She is transformed. Her body is no longer hers, but her eyes, her heart - she is still Karlach, for now. Only - there's a hunger in her eyes that wasn't there before.*
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach examines new mind flayer form.

372.speaker: Player
372.text: Karlach will become the mind flayer.
372.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

227.speaker: Player
227.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

316.speaker: Player
316.text: Hang on - no. We agreed. It's me. It has to be me.

373.speaker: Player
373.text: Hang on - no. We agreed. It's me. It has to be me.

280.speaker: Karlach
280.text: Hang on - no. We agreed. It's me. It has to be me.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Live on, soldier, for as long as you can. You deserve to spend your last moments as yourself.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: I'm pissed. I'm grateful. Gods! If I can't change your mind, I suppose I can only say... thank you.

63.speaker: The Emperor
63.text: I have the means to evolve you.

397.speaker: The Emperor
397.text: And your companion, too, it seems.

361.speaker: Player
361.text: We have another option. Gale's orb is still powerful enough to destroy the brain.
361.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

241.speaker: Gale
241.text: If that's the only way of putting an end to this gods-forsaken mess, I will not fail you.
241.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

284.speaker: The Emperor
284.text: No! It is too great a risk. The wizard has a history of being vulnerable to the temptations of power.

40.speaker: The Emperor
40.text: He cannot be relied upon for so great a task. Not unless we have exhausted all other options, and we have not.

125.speaker: The Emperor
125.text: You must give me the stones. Or embrace your own illithid evolution.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: If becoming an illithid is what it will take to wield the stones myself, I will do it.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: Give the stones to the Emperor.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Trust me, I know Gale. He'll do this.

221.speaker: Gale
221.text: I will, but we can't ignore the possibility that I don't make it to the brain. It won't hurt us to have a contingency.

396.speaker: Player
396.text: It will let me wield the stones. I accept.
396.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Take the stones. I trust you to wield them.
264.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

156.speaker: Player
156.text: I'm not going to be a mind flayer. Not in a million years.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

86.speaker: The Emperor
86.text: Then you will have to trust me. You will have to give me the stones.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: raises hand anticipating handover of netherstones from player

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Release the Netherstones to the Emperor.
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand now that player has refused to give stones

293.speaker: Player
293.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand now that player has refused to give stones

226.speaker: The Emperor
226.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers hand now that player has refused to give stones

359.speaker: The Emperor
359.text: I have been your salvation from the very beginning.
359.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

160.speaker: The Emperor
160.text: I told you we had one solution. You rejected it.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

45.speaker: The Emperor
45.text: I told you I sought only one thing - freedom. You have denied me this.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

266.speaker: The Emperor
266.text: You have exhausted our alliance, and in so doing, you have ruined us all.
266.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

257.speaker: The Emperor
257.text: I did everything I could to avoid this, but it seems you have whittled my options down to a single one.
257.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

47.speaker: The Emperor
47.text: In order to survive, I must now join the Netherbrain.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I don't have to do anything you say. I can free Orpheus.

398.speaker: Player
398.text: No. I'm going to find a way to free Orpheus.

362.speaker: The Emperor
362.text: You would be altered in mind, body, and soul beyond all recognition.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: No. I'm going to free Orpheus.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: No. I'm going to kill you, and find a way to free Orpheus.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: I still have the orb. I don't need the stones to destroy the brain, and the crown with it.

357.speaker: Player
357.text: Very well. But when the brain is defeated, the stones return to me.

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *Why should you be the one to make the sacrifice? You could let someone else take the fall. Or, give the stones to the Emperor, and when the moment comes, kill it, and take control.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Why make the sacrifice at all? You could give the Emperor the stones, and when the moment comes, kill it, and take control.*

337.speaker: Player
337.text: You can have the stones, but I won't let you assimilate Orpheus.
337.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

378.speaker: Player
378.text: I don't believe a word you just said.
378.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Orpheus is the enemy of my people. I mean to use the Hammer to free him - and kill him.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Orpheus is the future of my people. I mean to use the Hammer and set him free.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

238.speaker: Player
238.text: There is another way - we will free Orpheus.
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

43.speaker: Player
43.text: All life is sacred. I will not let you hurt the githyanki.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You will not lay a finger on my kin.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

87.speaker: The Emperor
87.text: You still don't trust me? After all we've been through?
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor puts its hand down after the player refuse to give the Netherstones

234.speaker: The Emperor
234.text: Remember - I have been your salvation from the very beginning. Your knight in shining armour.

15.speaker: The Emperor
15.text: I freed you from the nautiloid, prevented you from crashing to your death. I have protected you ever since - at no small cost to myself.

322.speaker: The Emperor
322.text: I came to you as a leader, but I did not shy away from showing you vulnerability. I needed you as much as you needed me. I was not above recognising this.

350.speaker: The Emperor
350.text: When you discovered my true identity, I did not flinch from truth - I never lied to you, not once. I am just like you. We have the same enemy, the same story.

147.speaker: The Emperor
147.text: I encouraged you to fulfil your potential, all while protecting you from harm.

385.speaker: The Emperor
385.text: And when you saw what I truly am - you did not reject me. You enjoyed me.

246.speaker: The Emperor
246.text: Now I ask you for the last time to trust me. Release the Netherstones to me.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: *You feel Lae'zel's parasite tremble. Her mind speaks directly to yours.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You feel Lae'zel's parasite tremble. Her mind speaks directly to yours.*

259.speaker: Lae'zel
259.text: There is another path. We yet hold the Hammer. We might still free Orpheus and strike him down!
259.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld over at end of line

222.speaker: Lae'zel
222.text: I figured this abominable alliance at an end. But I fear we may have no choice.
222.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Do not forget - there's a card yet to come into play. The orb. If we do not want to surrender the stones, I could still use it to ensure the brain's destruction. Along with my own, of course.
102.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

240.speaker: Gale
240.text: Do not forget - there's a card yet to come into play. The orb. If we do not want to surrender the stones, I could still use it to ensure the brain's destruction. Along with my own, of course.
240.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

334.speaker: The Emperor
334.text: This is a risk we cannot take. Your hubris drives you even now. You failed before, I cannot trust that you will not fail again.
334.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

391.speaker: The Emperor
391.text: You must trust me. Hand me the stones.
391.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

62.speaker: Player
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

251.speaker: Player
251.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

315.speaker: The Emperor
315.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I trust you. But I want to wield the stones - I want to be a mind flayer.
132.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

233.speaker: Player
233.text: We carry the means of the prince's release - and his death. This cannot be the way!
233.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

271.speaker: Lae'zel
271.text: We carry the means of the prince's release - and his death. This cannot be the way!
271.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Have you lost your senses? All we've been through, and you just give in to ceremorphosis now?!
70.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Have you lost your senses? All we've been through, and you just give in to ceremorphosis now?!
82.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

237.speaker: Shadowheart
237.text: Have you lost your senses? All we've been through, and you just give in to ceremorphosis now?!
237.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

268.speaker: Astarion
268.text: You're joking. Please tell me you're joking.
268.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

200.speaker: Wyll
200.text: Have you gone mad? The time we've spent avoiding this horrific fate, and now you'd succumb to it?
200.context: NodeContext: Karlach reacting in shock and anger and confusion to the player saying they want to be a mindflayer

256.speaker: Gale
256.text: Have you lost your wits?! You must not do this!
256.context: NodeContext: Karlach reacting in shock and anger and confusion to the player saying they want to be a mindflayer

178.speaker: Karlach
178.context: NodeContext: Karlach reacting in shock and anger and confusion to the player saying they want to be a mindflayer

384.speaker: Halsin
384.text: No - have you taken leave of your senses?!
384.context: NodeContext: shock and sorrow - her lover just offered to sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: No. No - you cannot do this.
7.context: NodeContext: shock and sorrow - her lover just offered to sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer

286.speaker: Minsc
286.text: Mourn, Boo - weep! The parasite has finally eaten our friend's brain!
286.context: NodeContext: shock and sorrow - her lover just offered to sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.context: NodeContext: shock and sorrow - her lover just offered to sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer

212.speaker: Player
212.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves player's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in player's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in player's palm. 
Shot of player's expression reacting to it.

404.speaker: The Emperor
404.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves player's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in player's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in player's palm. 
Shot of player's expression reacting to it.

311.speaker: The Emperor
311.text: Very well. I have the means to evolve you.
311.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves player's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in player's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in player's palm. 
Shot of player's expression reacting to it.

49.speaker: The Emperor
49.text: I took this one from the nautiloid. I have been nurturing it ever since - priming it for your use.
49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves player's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in player's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in player's palm. 
Shot of player's expression reacting to it.

182.text: It is not dissimilar to the experience you already had with the previous one. Only this one is much more potent.
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

1.speaker: The Emperor
1.text: It is not dissimilar to the experience you already had with the previous one. Only this one is much more potent.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

139.speaker: The Emperor
139.text: All you have to do is open your mind to it. Its latent potential will do the rest.
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

61.speaker: Player
61.text: What will it do to me exactly?
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, player turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

371.speaker: The Emperor
371.text: It will trigger ceremorphosis to completion.

32.speaker: The Emperor
32.text: First, you will feel discomfort. Then - flourishing.

335.speaker: The Emperor
335.text: You will transform into something superior - the full potential of your tadpole present in every sinew, every nerve. Pure thought, pure power.

98.speaker: The Emperor
98.text: You will be capable of dominating a Netherbrain.

121.speaker: Player
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, player turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

158.speaker: The Emperor
158.text: Yes. But if my own experience is anything to go by - you will have no regrets.

19.speaker: The Emperor
19.text: You will see the world as I do - its truth, its devastating beauty.

402.speaker: Player
402.text: Open your mind to the parasite.
402.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, player turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

239.text: *The boundary between thought and feeling is gone. Your mind and body are as one - bristling with concentrated cerebral energy.*
239.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, player turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

330.text: *The boundary between thought and feeling is gone. Your mind and body are as one - bristling with concentrated cerebral energy.*
330.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player examines their new mind flayer form.

250.speaker: Narrator
250.text: *The boundary between thought and feeling is gone. Your mind and body are as one - bristling with concentrated cerebral energy.*
250.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player examines their new mind flayer form.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

388.speaker: Narrator
388.text: *But there is something else - an emptiness to be filled, a hunger to be sated. It is overwhelming.*
388.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

317.speaker: The Emperor
317.text: You feel it, don't you, the hunger? Embrace it. Feed.
317.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Karlach feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

88.speaker: Player
88.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead - and you wield his power as ghaik.
3.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

23.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead - and you wield his power as ghaik.
23.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead - and you wield his power as ghaik.
81.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

379.speaker: Lae'zel
379.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead - and you wield his power as ghaik.
379.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

249.speaker: Lae'zel
249.text: My queen will see the truth and know this was the way forward. She will greet me in Tu'narath as the Comet's destroyer, the prince's ruin.
249.context: NodeContext: too-NAHR-eth. Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

300.speaker: The Emperor
300.text: I'm sure you will learn how to do it more gracefully with time.
300.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor wipes brain gunk off its face from our messy eating.

53.speaker: The Emperor
53.text: But you have done what is necessary.

265.speaker: The Emperor
265.text: The greater challenge now lies ahead of us - the Netherbrain.

281.text: Come, we must follow the brain's path. This time, we will not fail.

343.speaker: The Emperor
343.text: Come, we must follow the brain's path. This time, we will not fail.

254.speaker: Lae'zel
254.context: NodeContext: KRAYTH-rak - meaning heresy. Visceral and guttural response.

342.speaker: Lae'zel
342.text: I thought you my true kin. But you would keep your own people chained to their damnable queen!

332.speaker: Lae'zel
332.text: We have the means to free Prince Orpheus - and you side with ghaik!

333.speaker: Lae'zel
333.context: NodeContext: angry with betrayal and hurt

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: You want Orpheus dead? You'll have to kill me first.
60.context: NodeContext: she has only hatred left

41.speaker: Player
41.text: This is the only way, Lae'zel. You know it just as well as I do.

381.speaker: Lae'zel
381.text: Lies! You have been seduced by empty promises, ghaik tricks!

165.speaker: Lae'zel
165.text: To think I ever hoped for more from you...
165.context: NodeContext: coming down from rage to seething anger

236.speaker: Lae'zel
236.text: You have damned my people for eternity.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I trust the Emperor more than I trust Orpheus.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: To think I trusted you. At best you are a ghaik pawn. At worst, you are a coward.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: We may as well trust the Emperor - it already has the stones.
348.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player already gave the stones to the Emperor, betraying him by this point is game over

119.speaker: The Emperor
119.text: They are correct. Facing the Netherbrain without you would not be easy, but I will do it if I must.
119.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

301.speaker: Lae'zel
301.text: Only a newborn could be so naive.
301.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: It manipulates you. It's made you its thrall. And you blindly totter your way to oblivion.
10.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

393.speaker: Lae'zel
393.text: Assimilate Orpheus, and I will rip off your every limb and bask in your agony!
393.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Wait - we can still free Orpheus.

140.speaker: The Emperor
140.text: You forget - I have the stones. Without them, you will accomplish nothing.

44.speaker: The Emperor
44.text: So the githyanki lives, what then are you left with? What ideas remain untested?

383.speaker: The Emperor
383.text: How will you defeat a Netherbrain?

354.speaker: The Emperor
354.text: Your only choice is to trust me.

309.speaker: Player
309.text: You're right, Lae'zel. We cannot let Orpheus be assimilated.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I know how big this is to you, but trust me Lae'zel. Trust me.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: We will end the Grand Design. And then we will go our separate ways.

294.text: No more words. I gave you my trust - and you failed me.

126.speaker: Lae'zel
126.text: No more words. I gave you my trust - and you failed me.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: We have no way to free Orpheus. Assimilation is our only option.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Fool. You can't defeat the Netherbrain and end the Grand Design on your own.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: To think I once called you zhak vo'n'fynh duj...

118.speaker: Lae'zel
118.context: NodeContext: HTA-lak KRITH ma-HAR! - Die, treacherous scum!

215.speaker: Player
215.text: If it means that much to you, Lae'zel, I won't kill Orpheus.

376.speaker: Player
376.text: We'll find another way. I will not sacrifice Orpheus.

399.speaker: The Emperor
399.text: So easily persuaded, so quick to turn...

12.speaker: The Emperor
12.text: I am glad to have uncovered your weakness before facing the Netherbrain.

74.speaker: The Emperor
74.text: My chances of success would have been improved by your presence. But no matter, I will do what must be done. Alone.

207.speaker: The Emperor
207.text: I will assimilate Orpheus. And without his protection, you will perish. Just like I said you would.

401.speaker: Lae'zel
401.text: You would keep my people chained to their damnable queen. I should've trusted my gut, driven a blade through your throat at first chance.

124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

273.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Player (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: If Gale's solution doesn't work, you have my word - I will do what is necessary.
157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stows the supreme tadpole away.

327.speaker: The Emperor
327.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stows the supreme tadpole away.

285.speaker: The Emperor
285.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor 'powers down' the globe of domination (aka with a gesture of his hand, he waves it away so that Orpheus is accessible.)

152.speaker: The Emperor
152.text: You will need to be fully illithid before you confront the Netherbrain.
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor 'powers down' the globe of domination (aka with a gesture of his hand, he waves it away so that Orpheus is accessible.)

303.speaker: The Emperor
303.text: Now stand aside. I will assimilate the githyanki's power in your stead.
303.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor 'powers down' the globe of domination (aka with a gesture of his hand, he waves it away so that Orpheus is accessible.)

208.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor 'powers down' the globe of domination (aka with a gesture of his hand, he waves it away so that Orpheus is accessible.)

386.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor wraps its tentacles around Orpheus' face and brinngs its mouth over Orpheus' head. Suckling noises as it feeds. 
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

95.speaker: The Emperor
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player wiping brain gunk from their eye with disgust.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead, his power taken to end the ghaik Grand Design.
150.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

358.speaker: Lae'zel
358.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead, his power taken to end the ghaik Grand Design.
358.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: We hold the Hammer in hand, and you stood against me. Still - I see a path to ascension.
108.context: NodeContext: too-NAHR-eth. Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: My queen will see the truth and know this was the way forward. She will greet me in Tu'narath as the Comet's destroyer, the prince's ruin.
191.context: NodeContext: too-NAHR-eth. Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: Good. I would rather put my trust in you than in that thing.
54.context: NodeContext: disgust on final word - she's talking about the Emperor, the party's 'friendly' mind flayer that she hasn't trusted since the minute she met it

353.speaker: Lae'zel
353.text: Tsk'va. If this must be our sacrifice, so be it. The prince will fall, praise Vlaakith - and we will take his powers.

324.speaker: Lae'zel
324.text: We will destroy the Netherbrain - and I will ascend to my queen's side!

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Why should I trust you? You withheld information from me at every turn.
190.context: NodeContext: cuts himself off as he figured it out

115.speaker: The Emperor
115.text: It is true that I withheld reality. I showed Orpheus and his guard as evil beings.

122.speaker: The Emperor
122.text: And I appeared to you in the form of someone you would trust - someone who wasn't a mind flayer.

382.speaker: The Emperor
382.text: But I am a mind flayer.

338.speaker: The Emperor
338.text: Illusion is my language. Just as words and actions are yours.

328.speaker: The Emperor
328.text: Do not judge me for being true to myself. I have never judged you.

276.speaker: Player
276.context: NodeContext: cuts himself off as he figured it out

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Enough. I have the Hammer - I will free Orpheus!
144.context: NodeContext: cuts himself off as he figured it out

289.speaker: The Emperor
289.text: You're lying. His chains are unbreakable. The only way to break them is -
289.context: NodeContext: cuts himself off as he figured it out

355.speaker: The Emperor
355.text: No... Impossible... You would have had to make a deal with the devil himself. And if you had, I would know. I have had access to your thoughts the entire -

13.speaker: The Emperor
13.text: That was the silence I felt, wasn't it? When I lost you?
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

22.speaker: The Emperor
22.text: You took the devil's deal. And lied to me.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

253.speaker: The Emperor
253.text: And there I was thinking you trusted me.
253.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

387.speaker: The Emperor
387.text: The way that I trusted you.
387.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

235.speaker: The Emperor
235.text: It is a shame we could not have cooperated. Your powers of manipulation are quite something.
235.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

291.speaker: The Emperor
291.text: Very well. Since you will not work with me, you work against me.
291.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

142.speaker: The Emperor
142.text: You leave me no option but to join the Netherbrain.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

128.speaker: The Emperor
128.text: After everything I've done for you.

262.speaker: The Emperor
262.text: I thought you understood the value of your freedom when you destroyed the contract that bound you to deliver the Crown.

339.speaker: The Emperor
339.text: But now you insist on freeing the githyanki, and risking everything we worked towards.

375.speaker: The Emperor
375.text: You choose to side with the devil.

187.speaker: The Emperor
187.text: You would free the githyanki, and risk everything we've worked towards.

258.speaker: The Emperor
258.text: I had hoped for better, but I can't say I'm surprised.

365.speaker: The Emperor
365.text: It was always in your nature to give in to temptation.

360.speaker: The Emperor
360.text: You reasoned well, but chose poorly.

326.speaker: The Emperor
326.text: I told you we have to trust one another.

16.speaker: The Emperor
16.text: I told you the githyanki would only want to kill you for what you are.

228.speaker: The Emperor
228.text: Still, you choose to break our alliance.

313.speaker: The Emperor
313.text: Even united, the Netherbrain was going to be an impossible enemy. But apart - we have no chance of survival.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I still have the orb. I don't need the stones to destroy the brain, and the crown with it.

346.speaker: The Emperor
346.text: Your hubris drives you even now. You failed before, I cannot trust that you will not fail again.

117.speaker: The Emperor
117.text: If you insist on doing this, I cannot stop you. But there is a better way, a way in which you live.

155.speaker: The Emperor
155.text: Hand me the stones, Gale. It is the only way we will guarantee our success.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Very well. But when the brain is defeated, the stones return to me.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: Enough. I have the Hammer - I will deal with Orpheus myself!

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No, now is the time to liberate him!
180.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

224.speaker: Lae'zel
224.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No, now is the time to liberate him!
224.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No - we must liberate him!
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No - we must liberate him!
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

21.speaker: The Emperor
21.text: Impossible. You have no means of liberating the githyanki prince. If the Netherbrain is to fall, the prince must be assimilated.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: This fella and its ultimatums. But he's forgetting one thing.

248.speaker: Karlach
248.text: This fella and its ultimatums. But he's forgetting one thing.

283.speaker: Karlach
283.text: We could become illithid. I mean, I could. You could trust me to do what needs to be done.

184.speaker: The Emperor
184.text: There are important matters to discuss - I intend to discuss them with your leader. Send them to me.

270.speaker: The Emperor
270.text: I trust you have aired opinions and grievances, and made your decision? Are you ready to become a mind flayer?

349.speaker: The Emperor
349.text: I admire the githyanki, you know. What she lacked in foresight, she made up for with passion.

229.speaker: The Emperor
229.text: But passion is a consolation prize for those who lack intellect.

173.speaker: The Emperor
173.text: I am glad to see that you lack neither, and did what had to be done.

214.speaker: The Emperor
214.text: I am glad that not all of your companions are such slaves to it, and that one among you did what needed to be done.

269.speaker: The Emperor
269.text: Now enough of this distraction - we must assimilate Orpheus.
